author: Emily Bobrow
title: ‘The Art of the Wasted Day’ Review: Fallen Idylls
text:
Life, if you’re lucky, is divided into thirds: youth, middle age and “you look good.” For Patricia Hampl, this quip of her father’s feels freshly relevant now that, as she acknowledges, most of her life is behind her. Like many who feel their days are numbered, she finds herself looking back with wistful ambivalence on years “awash in the brackish flotsam of endeavor, failure and success, responsibility and reward.”
“The Art of the Wasted Day” is a memoir haunted by death. Having lost not only her parents—the subjects of...
